intro: Myosotis pusilla subsp. multiflora, commonly known as the dwarf forget-me-not, is a small herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, with slender stems and clusters of tiny, sky-blue flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. This subspecies is notable for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
